description: Comprehensive verification scoring rubric for Claude Code plugins marketplace

security.description: Security best practices and vulnerability prevention

criteria.name: No Hardcoded Secrets
criteria.description: Plugin contains no hardcoded API keys, tokens, passwords, or credentials

criteria.name: No Dangerous Patterns
criteria.description: Plugin contains no dangerous commands like rm -rf /, eval, or command injection patterns

criteria.name: Input Validation
criteria.description: All user inputs are validated and sanitized (MCP plugins use Zod schemas)

criteria.name: Scoped Permissions
criteria.description: Skills declare minimal allowed-tools required for functionality

documentation.description: Quality and completeness of plugin documentation

criteria.name: Complete README
criteria.description: README.md includes description, installation, usage examples, and troubleshooting

criteria.name: Valid Plugin Manifest
criteria.description: plugin.json contains all required fields with proper semver versioning

criteria.name: Examples Provided
criteria.description: Plugin includes clear usage examples and sample outputs

criteria.name: License Present
criteria.description: LICENSE file exists with open-source license (MIT, Apache-2.0 recommended)

functionality.description: Plugin functionality, schema compliance, and quality

criteria.name: Components Present
criteria.description: Plugin includes at least one functional component (command, agent, skill, or hook)

criteria.name: Schema Compliant
criteria.description: All components follow 2026 schema standards (YAML frontmatter, required fields)

criteria.name: Tests Passing
criteria.description: MCP plugins include tests with passing status (instruction plugins exempt)

criteria.name: Error Handling
criteria.description: Plugin includes proper error handling and graceful failure modes

maintenance.description: Plugin maintenance, updates, and long-term support

criteria.name: Stable Version
criteria.description: Plugin uses semantic versioning with stable release (>= 1.0.0 or clear beta status)

criteria.name: Updated Recently
criteria.description: Plugin updated within last 90 days (30 days for Enterprise badge)

criteria.name: Dependencies Current
criteria.description: All dependencies are up-to-date with no critical vulnerabilities

criteria.name: CI/CD Present
criteria.description: Plugin has CI/CD workflow for automated testing and validation

criteria.name: Issue Responsiveness
criteria.description: Plugin maintainer responds to issues/PRs within reasonable timeframe

A.label: Excellent
A.description: Enterprise-ready plugin with exceptional quality across all categories

B.label: Good
B.description: High-quality plugin with strong fundamentals and good maintenance

C.label: Acceptable
C.description: Functional plugin meeting basic standards with room for improvement

D.label: Needs Work
D.description: Plugin meets minimum requirements but lacks polish or maintenance

F.label: Failing
F.description: Plugin fails core requirements and should not be used in production

1.name: Core
1.description: Basic verification - plugin is safe to use

2.name: Standard
2.description: Standard quality - plugin follows best practices

3.name: Verified
3.description: Verified quality - plugin is well-maintained and documented

4.name: Enterprise
4.description: Enterprise-ready - plugin meets highest quality standards

5.name: Certified
5.description: Certified - plugin has undergone formal security audit and review

scoring.calculation: Sum of all earned points across all categories (max 100)
scoring.requiredCriteriaFailure: If any required criterion fails, overall score capped at 59 (Grade F)
scoring.categoryWeighting: All categories equally weighted at 25 points each

automation.automated: Run via scripts/validate-all-plugins.sh and CI workflows
automation.frequency: Automated checks run on every PR/push, manual reviews quarterly

badgeEligibility.description: Plugins earn badges based on specific criteria achievements
eligibilityRules: Badges are additive - plugins can earn multiple badges
Badge requirements checked automatically on each validation run
Manual badges (Popular, Performance) require quarterly review
Badge revocation occurs if plugin falls below criteria threshold
